root.name: Project Eternity
root.description: OverviewProject Eternity is the codename for an isometric viewpoint, party-based RPG developed by Obsidian Entertainment. Players will quest through a original fantasy world based on roughly 16th century medieval technology levels, where magic and power is determined by the quality of a person's soul.Obsidian's stated goal is to create an experience reminiscent of classic Infinity Engine franchises, such as Icewind Dale, Planescape: Torment, and Baldur's Gate.The game will be built on the Unity 4 Engine and released on Windows, Mac, and Linux platforms.Mods will be supported.GameplayPlayers will be able to create a player character, selecting from several races and assigning them one of the follow classes: Fighter, Rogue, Wizard, Priest, Monk, Ranger, Druid, Barbarian, or Cipher. The player may gather a party of up to 6 companions. All party members are fully controllable by the player.The gameplay will be presented from an isometric angle through 2D rendered backgrounds, with 3D character models layered on top. The combat will take place in real-time with some pausing.The game will include a crafting and enchanting system to create custom items.KickstarterOn September 14th, 2012 Obsidian launched a Kickstarter campaign to fund the game. The campaign is scheduled to end on October 16th, 2012. They surpassed their funding goal of $1.1 million after 27 hours with the contribution of their 26,888th backer. After reaching the base goal they announced several stretch goals:1.4 million - New playable race, class, companion.*1.6 million - Mac and Linux version and new quest, NPC, location*1.8 million - More playable race, class, companion*2.0 million - Player house*2.2 million - New region, faction and another companion, language translations*2.3 million - Expert mode, Ironman mode, Path of the Damned mode*2.4 million - Crafting and Enchanting systems*2.5 million - Barbarian and Cipher classes*2.6 million - Adventurer's Hall*2.7 million - Addition of Paladin and Chanter classes*2.8 million - George Ziets, the creative lead and core writer for Mask of the Betrayer, will join the project*3.0 million - Stronghold, along with related content such as quests and surrounding environment*3.5 million - Second 'big' city, similar to Athkatla in Baldur's Gate series*4 million - Live instrumentation for the soundtrack, add developer in-game commentary and enhance the Whole Game.**achievedIn additional, a mega-dungeon has been announced called The Endless Paths, with each additional 2500 Kickstarter backers above 50,000 contributing to the creation of an additional level of the dungeon.The Kickstarter ended on October 17th after raising $4,163,208 (including Paypal) from 77,667 backers.For more information see the dedicated Kickstarter page.
